page.title: 15The Village Hall Diddlebury
page.content: A committee of twenty members was formed on September 12th 1945 to build a Victory Thanksgiving Hall. The site was donated by Mr V. Wrigley, owner of Delbury Hall and Estate. The estimated cost was Â£3,900. The Hall was opened on March 28th 1951 by Lady Boyne. The name was changed to Diddlebury Village Hall in June 1951. An extension was built in Spring 1974. The Hall has an entrance Hall with Ladies and gentlemens cloakroom toilets on either side. The wooden floor in the Hall came from a ship's boards. It has a large curtained stage and a good kitchen opening onto the hall by a hatch. Mrs Radford holds the keys to the hall and takes the bookings. It is hired regularly by many organisations and by people for private functions.
